title: A N is associate professor of history and classical studies and the Canada Research Chair in Early Modern British History at McGill University. His current research involves the politics of celebrity in Britain from the regicidal revolution to the American Revolution. He is the author of The Social Life of Coffee: The Emergence of the British Coffeehouse
which uses book history to provide a new understanding of the most important political trial of the eighteenth century
